cz.ive.manager
Class ManagerOfSenses

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.manager.ManagerOfSenses
All Implemented Interfaces:
MoveAware, Listener, java.io.Serializable
public class ManagerOfSenses
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoveAware, Listener, java.io.Serializable

In our implementation, only one instance of manager is created and it's accesible by static class member 'manager'. Other instances of class can be created.

Documentation of manager of senses implementation

Manager have following structures for managed objects:
  • multi-map of objects searchable by ID of wayPoint where it's situated
    used for getting objects applicable for query evaulation
  • multi-map of passive queries searchable by ID wayPoint where the query is valid - could be a lot of wayPoints
  • multi-map of passive updates of objects searchable by ID of updated object
  • there are other three structures for managing changes caused by sensors movements:
    • map of root wayPoints of Sensors
      only change of this wayPoints means that there is a change in view of the sensor and other actions are performed
    • multi-map where all passive updates for each sensor that is used by them are
    • multi-map where all passive queries for each sensor that is used by them are

Query evaulation

All location where query is valid are obtained by intersection of query LOD and sensors LOD.
Input objects are obtained according to locations and specified role.
There is Set Expr as the main part of the query. Its leaves are Fuzzy Expr - they are obtained and evaulated for each input object - if it satisfies, it's procceded to Set Expr. The root of this Expr is set of resulting objects.
Result is compouded according to flag specifying whether all object or only one should be returned and whether their copies should be empty or filled according to sensors.
For passive queries, the box containing result set is returned and it notified it's listeners every time when there is a change in this set.

Author:
Jirka

addSensor

void addSensor(Sensor sensor)
Adds a sensor to all structures, registers to it, unregisters from the old one. Counts usages of each sensor. Handles change of the reference to new sensor with the same id.

Parameters:
sensor - Sensor to add

removeSensor

void removeSensor(Sensor sensor)
Removes a sensor from all structures, unregisters from it. Uses a reference counting not to remove sensors used somewhere else.

Parameters:
sensor - Sensor to remove

isInSensorsRange

public boolean isInSensorsRange(Sensor sensor,
                                WayPoint wayPoint)
Tests whether objects on a WayPoint can be sensed by a sensor. Note that no object can by sensed by sensor which is not in valid state.

Parameters:
sensor - Sensor which may sense the object
wayPoint - WayPoint whose objects may be sensed by the sensor.
Returns:
true iff the Object is in a radius of the sensor

isApplicableSensor

public boolean isApplicableSensor(Sensor sensor,
                                  IveObject object)
Tests whether an object can be sensed by a sensor. Note that no object can by sensed by sensor which is not in valid state.

Parameters:
sensor - Sensor which may sense the object
object - Object which may be sensed by the sensor. this object should not be a phantom, or it has to have the lod parameter properly set.
Returns:
true iff the Object is in a radius of the sensor

updateCopyActive

public boolean updateCopyActive(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                IveObject copy)
Updates a copy of the given IveObject according to sensors

Parameters:
sensors - list of sensors to filter object
copy - object to update
Returns:
whether the update was successful, says nothing about changes; false is returned when no such valid object is founded or updated object is valid or object is not visible by any sensor

updateCopyPassive

public QTUpdate updateCopyPassive(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                  IveObject copy)
Updates a copy of the given IveObject according to sensors and then after each other change with notifying also.

Parameters:
sensors - list of sensors to filter object
copy - object to update
Returns:
box - hook - where copy is stored and will be updated or null when given IveObject is not found or if it's valid object

queryActive

public java.util.List<IveObject> queryActive(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                             OntologyToken query,
                                             Substitution sources,
                                             ManagerOfSenses.ReturnSet flags)
                                      throws OntologyNotSupportedException
One-shot processing of query.

Parameters:
sensors - list of sensors to filter query input objects
query - ontology containing all query data
sources - substitution with passed variables, can be null
flags - mode of creation of the return set
Returns:
set of all objects which passed the query
Throws:
OntologyNotSupportedException

queryPassive

public QTQuery queryPassive(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                            OntologyToken query,
                            Substitution sources,
                            ManagerOfSenses.ReturnSet flag)
                     throws OntologyNotSupportedException
Process query, stores it and will be recounts all changes in result.

Parameters:
sensors - list of sensors to filter query input objects
query - ontology containing all query data
sources - substitution with passed variables, can be null
flag - mode of creation of the return set
Returns:
box with set of all objects which passed the query and which signalizes changes in that set
Throws:
OntologyNotSupportedException

collectInputObjects

protected void collectInputObjects(WayPoint root,
                                   java.util.List<Pair<Sensor,WayPoint>> sensors,
                                   Link role,
                                   LOD lod,
                                   java.util.Set<IveObject> set)
Recursively calling method to realize the getInputObjects method. Recursively backtrakcs the tree of WayPoints to the depth and builds the set of the objects.

Parameters:
root - Root of the tree to backtrack
sensors - Sensors to consider
role - Role of the searched objects
lod - Lod of the query, can be null
set - Incrementally builded result set

getInputObjects

public java.util.Set<IveObject> getInputObjects(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                                Link role,
                                                LOD lod)
Gets all object for query according to the query sensors and role name. Recursively searches the location tree with cutting-off.

Parameters:
sensors - All sensors to consider
role - only objects with link containing this role name are accepted or null can be passed
lod - Lod range of the query, can be null
Returns:
Set of all objects of the given role, wich can be sensed by at least one of the given sensors.

getInputObjects

private java.util.HashSet<IveObject> getInputObjects(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> locations,
                                                     Link role)
Gets all objects for query according to given locations and role name.

Parameters:
locations - all locations where object can appear
role - only objects with link containing this role name are accepted or null can be passed
Returns:
set of all suitable IveObjects

updateCopy

boolean updateCopy(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                   IveObject orig,
                   IveObject copy,
                   QTUpdate listener)
Update copy of IveObject clipped by sensors according to original.

Parameters:
sensors - list of sensors which specified set of visible attributes and whether object is in view distance
orig - original IveObject to be compared with updated copy
copy - IveObject to be updated
listener - if it isn't null, it's registered by each attribute which is added to copy
Returns:
whether some change was made

Parameters:

Returns:

makeResultSet

java.util.List<IveObject> makeResultSet(java.util.List<IveObject> oldRes,
                                        java.util.Set<IveObject> originSet,
                                        java.util.List<Sensor> sensors,
                                        ManagerOfSenses.ReturnSet flag)
Construct result set of copies from given original IveObject according to flag.

Parameters:
oldRes - result from previsious calling - objects are reused; null can be passed.
originSet - set of valid IveObjects
sensors - list of sensors to be applied while objects are copied
flag - specifies how will be result formed
Returns:
list of IveObject copies
